commit_message:
Move flushing block devices to privsep.

A similar pattern to the others. Maybe we should write a more fully fledged
wrapper around blockdev at some point, but I think its not required yet.

Change-Id: Ie65d7c90abd0f8448500089fa48e831aef7b7abf
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-03 02:35:10.000000000', 'message': "Convert ext filesystem resizes to privsep.

Note: this patch is interesting because its the first time that we've
implemented an _optional_ escalation in privsep, and I want to make
sure we're happy with this pattern before I do any more like this.

Its potentially confusing that something inside the privsep directory
isn't escalated, but its a security requirement of escalated methods
that they only call code within their own subpath of nova.

I'd appreciate comments on this approach.

Change-Id: Ie09e40d6476dcabda2d599e96701d419e3e8bdf0

commit_message:
Convert ext filesystem resizes to privsep.

This patch introduces the first code in the privsep directory which
_does_not_ run with escalated premissions. This is a requirement because
the privsep code has a restricted python path when executing. This
pattern will be used for other methods which are only sometimes
escalated.

Change-Id: Ie09e40d6476dcabda2d599e96701d419e3e8bdf0
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-19 21:27:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix vSwitch extension check

A recent change introduced a regression that prevents the neutron
agent from starting.

The issue consists in misusing a vswitch extension argument when
validating it (it's a dict, but handled as a string).

This change fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I19c618a51c50eb1a18a93bd946a12075ba8d004e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix vSwitch extension check

A recent change introduced a regression that prevents the neutron
agent from starting.

The issue consists in misusing a vswitch extension argument when
validating it (it's a dict, but handled as a string).

This change fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I19c618a51c50eb1a18a93bd946a12075ba8d004e

commit_message:
Add [designate] section in neutron.conf

If neutron_designate_enabled variable is true,
this will enable the [designate] section and all needed configuration.

Change-Id: I82469a1de6a7ebce8ca2f568c1bb8125bbc57965
Closes-Bug: 1687594
Depends-On: I46316c658a3746f91313641e5a26de49a03b2164

commit_message:
Fix doc building

With recent changes to the doc jobs, we need to specificy that python3
is used. Update the zuul config file for this.

Change-Id: I7518a84ed780f4fd9ce8572f078c519021044885

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-14 22:00:38.000000000', 'message': 'Zuulv3: Add some devstack nodesets

These illustrate a way to set up nodes and groups for devstack jobs
that can scale out to more multinode jobs later.  They can also be
used for other deployment systems (thus the openstack-name).  We
can move these into openstack-zuul-jobs later.

They create a tempest group that includes the controller node, but
creating its own group gives us the possibility to move it to other
nodes later (for instance, a nodeset where tempest did not run on
the controller).

Change-Id: I682ad9a65bd980cb8921b63d16176b88155ce742
'}]
commit_message:
Zuulv3: Add some devstack nodesets

These illustrate a way to set up nodes and groups for devstack jobs
that can scale out to more multinode jobs later.  They can also be
used for other deployment systems (thus the openstack-name).  We
can move these into openstack-zuul-jobs later.

They create a tempest group that includes the controller node, but
creating its own group gives us the possibility to move it to other
nodes later (for instance, a nodeset where tempest did not run on
the controller).

Change-Id: I682ad9a65bd980cb8921b63d16176b88155ce742

Add [designate] section in neutron.conf

If neutron_designate_enabled variable is true,
this will enable the [designate] section and all needed configuration.

doc: add note about fixing admin-only APIs without a microversion

This is a follow up to change I947e927802f755ccb25a91efd82cac895779d19e
to document the decision and agreements made in that change about fixing
obvious regression bugs in admin-only APIs without a microversion.

Related-Bug: #1733886

commit_message:
Shift tripleo-ci from infra to tripleo

The tripleo-ci repo is an infra repo for historical reasons that don't
make any sense any more.

Recognize that the content in this repo is actually owned and managed by
the TripleO team and not the Infra team.

Change-Id: Ic61941feb817ed8a12cedf330b5aed7b60aa284d

commit_message:
Add telemetry-tempest-plugin to telemetry project

Create a new repository for telemetry's tempest plugin to fulfill
Queens Goal "Split Tempest Plugins into Separate Repos/Projects".

It contains tempest plugin for all Telemetry projects.

Depends-On: I533e3edb6102ea871a5c0bf72299fb0da7a13c52
Change-Id: Ie9e5b48ccdacb4cea08f1525d23348f7398c9dbf

commit_message:
Retire puppet-apps_site

The app catalog was retired earlier this year, see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2017-July/013965.html

Since the site and repos are retired, we can retire the puppet module as
well.

Change-Id: I699aba4426db45f2a62b945a41304564e0724470
Depends-On: I638cc127d3588d757a4da01984a2bd292a84413c

Mark the completion of Tempest Plugin Split goal for Freezer Team

* https://review.openstack.org/526667 and https://review.openstack.org/526914

  home freezer-tempest-plugin.

commit_message:
Fix elasticsearch curator file entry in configmap

Fixes an issue preventing the elastic curator configuration being
populated via elasticsearch's values.yaml

Change-Id: I74901c1aa99abc56a06ea95ca9ea9d818761d79b

commit_message:
add dry-run or list-tasks to quickstart.sh

This will help users understand what will run
prior to actually running quickstart.  This
could also be using in debugging playbooks.

Closes-Bug: #1736811
Change-Id: Ic4d9e2e9c25dc51a26356ce86dbc677c5c5a6f3a

commit_message:
Add Basic Authentication support for HAProxy

In order to get a proper support for authenticated endpoints, this patch
creates a new definition (tripleo::haproxy::userlist) and exploit it in
the dynamic endpoint (tripleo::haproxy::service_endpoints) as well as
standard tripleo::haproxy::endpoint.

It also detected a small issue with the "underscorization" of the
service name, the missing 'G' flag for regsubst, that preventend all
dashes to be replaced by underscores.

Change-Id: Ie7471155d1ef3f6adc177a468b81ac410bbfb9c0
Closes-Bug: 1736132

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-18 17:09:37.000000000', 'message': 'Allow wsrep_max_ws_rows and wsrep_max_ws_size to use defaults

Starting with MariaDB 10.1.17 / 10.0.27, the wsrep_max_ws_rows
setting suddenly becomes meaningful, as with previous releases
it had no effect [1].   At the same time, MariaDB has changed
the default value from 131072 to "0" which means no limit,
so that their providing this functionality didn't break anything.
This breaks it for tripleo because we are hardcoding that
never-functional default which makes for much too small writesets.

On the MySQL-Galera side, the wsrep_max_ws_rows setting continues
to have no meaningful effect. [2] [3]

Additionally, the size of a writeset is more usefully limited
by the wsrep_max_ws_size variable, which here is also hardcoded
to an obselete default of 1G, the aforementioned MariaDB versions
have also bumped the default to 2G.

I've looked up the origin of these settings in [4] and see
no useful rationale for these numbers to be present, rather than
allowing database-provided defaults to be used.

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/galera-cluster-system-variables/#wsrep_max_ws_rows
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/codership-mysql/+bug/1373909
[3] https://github.com/codership/mysql-wsrep/issues/257
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177765/

Change-Id: I0d25666fed15347c8351f127d8f564b2037ca065
Closes-bug: #1738777
'}, {'created': '2017-12-18 17:19:46.000000000', 'message': 'Allow wsrep_max_ws_rows and wsrep_max_ws_size to use defaults

Starting with MariaDB 10.1.17 / 10.0.27, the wsrep_max_ws_rows
setting suddenly becomes meaningful, as with previous releases
it had no effect [1].   At the same time, MariaDB has changed
the default value from 131072 to "0" which means no limit,
so that their providing this functionality didn't break anything.
This breaks it for tripleo because we are hardcoding that
never-functional default which makes for much too small writesets.

On the MySQL-Galera side, it's unclear if
the wsrep_max_ws_rows setting yet has a meaningful effect, as [2] [3] remain
open but then in [4] they advertise that it *does* work, but
again they've changed the default to 0/no limit.

Additionally, the size of a writeset is more usefully limited
by the wsrep_max_ws_size variable, which here is also hardcoded
to an obselete default of 1G, the aforementioned MariaDB versions
have also bumped the default to 2G.

I've looked up the origin of these settings in [5] and see
no useful rationale for these numbers to be present, rather than
allowing database-provided defaults to be used.

In all cases it is definite that the wsrep_max_ws_rows setting
of 131072 has never been used by any of the MariaDB/MySQL/Galera
variants and we should not be setting this.

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/galera-cluster-system-variables/#wsrep_max_ws_rows
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/codership-mysql/+bug/1373909
[3] https://github.com/codership/mysql-wsrep/issues/257
[4] http://galeracluster.com/2016/08/announcing-galera-cluster-5-5-50-and-5-6-31-with-galera-3-17/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177765/

Change-Id: I0d25666fed15347c8351f127d8f564b2037ca065
Closes-bug: #1738777
'}]
commit_message:
Allow wsrep_max_ws_rows and wsrep_max_ws_size to use defaults

Starting with MariaDB 10.1.17 / 10.0.27, the wsrep_max_ws_rows
setting suddenly becomes meaningful, as with previous releases
it had no effect [1].   At the same time, MariaDB has changed
the default value from 131072 to "0" which means no limit,
so that their providing this functionality didn't break anything.
This breaks it for tripleo because we are hardcoding that
never-functional default which makes for much too small writesets.

On the MySQL-Galera side, it's unclear if
the wsrep_max_ws_rows setting yet has a meaningful effect, as [2] [3] remain
open but then in [4] they advertise that it *does* work, but
again they've changed the default to 0/no limit.

Additionally, the size of a writeset is more usefully limited
by the wsrep_max_ws_size variable, which here is also hardcoded
to an obselete default of 1G, the aforementioned MariaDB versions
have also bumped the default to 2G.

I've looked up the origin of these settings in [5] and see
no useful rationale for these numbers to be present, rather than
allowing database-provided defaults to be used.

In all cases it is definite that the wsrep_max_ws_rows setting
of 131072 has never been used by any of the MariaDB/MySQL/Galera
variants and we should not be setting this.

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/galera-cluster-system-variables/#wsrep_max_ws_rows
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/codership-mysql/+bug/1373909
[3] https://github.com/codership/mysql-wsrep/issues/257
[4] http://galeracluster.com/2016/08/announcing-galera-cluster-5-5-50-and-5-6-31-with-galera-3-17/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177765/

Change-Id: I0d25666fed15347c8351f127d8f564b2037ca065

commit_message:
Add reproducer script for OVB and multinode jobs

This review adds functionality to create a reproducer
script in the logs. The reproducer script will allow
users to recreate failing OVB and multinode jobs
in personal cloud tenants.

User documentation for the reproducer-quickstart script
is added.

Change-Id: I9fe8550a75c3ffb6d1271b01b1144bfbdc82c95d

commit_message:
undercloud: set default_resource_class to 'baremetal'

We already default to this value when enrolling nodes with our workflows, and when
upgrading an undercloud to Pike. This change ensures that nodes enrolled outside
of our workflows also default to 'baremetal'.

A similar change to instack-undercloud is Iee8604a6a942c12e6fa6b9cb8ea88a2cee1ead8f

Change-Id: I8c3c45810571a5d58d8d3c21561b96186d2ebbb2
Partial-Bug: #1732190

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 18:27:21.000000000', 'message': 'schedule gateway on chassis with external connectivity

Currently ovn schedules gateway router ports on all chassis.
Instead we need to check which chassis has external connectivity
and schedule them only on these chassis.

Chassis which has ovn-bridge-mappings properly configured(i.e
physnet same as gateway network physnet) in OVN_Southbound
database will be treated as having external connectivity.
Some network types(for example, geneve) may not use bridge
mappings. Currently, external networks of type VLAN and FLAT
use bridge mappings. So for these networks, we return chassis
with proper bridge mappings and for other networks we return
all chassis.

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py
    networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py
    networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py
    networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_router.py

Closes-bug: #1705246

commit_message:
schedule gateway on chassis with external connectivity

Currently ovn schedules gateway router ports on all chassis.
Instead we need to check which chassis has external connectivity
and schedule them only on these chassis.

Chassis which has ovn-bridge-mappings properly configured(i.e
physnet same as gateway network physnet) in OVN_Southbound
database will be treated as having external connectivity.
Some network types(for example, geneve) may not use bridge
mappings. Currently, external networks of type VLAN and FLAT
use bridge mappings. So for these networks, we return chassis
with proper bridge mappings and for other networks we return
all chassis.

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py
    networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py
    networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py
    networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_router.py

Closes-bug: #1705246
Change-Id: I73970aef6d84019032e3c68a6a785d7626ae2afc
(cherry picked from commit 14d8e70cfae41fed5e9515dddda714b54a3c67bf)

commit_message:
Add monasca-tempest-plugin to monasca project

Create a new repository for monasca's tempest plugin to fulfill
Queens Goal "Split Tempest Plugins into Separate Repos/Projects".

Depends-On: Ifd8429e4ef96034a804514e71852e11829340a87
Change-Id: Ibb1c5975c8618df060e3c2791a7ac186d0e31335

[{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2017-11-12 20:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2017-11-23 01:18:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm thinking if we could use this config for a full deployment of master undercloud + newton overcloud, not restricted to keystone only demo. if that's the case, then there is a minor issue about telemetry args, which will be enabled (for example, in general_config/minimal.yml) when 'release != newton', this will lead to overcloud deployment failure since 'environments/disable-telemetry.yaml' is not included in tripleo-heat-templates stable/newton branch."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2017-11-23 14:16:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I'm thinking if we could use this config for a full deployment of
 > master undercloud + newton overcloud, not restricted to keystone
 > only demo. if that's the case, then there is a minor issue about
 > telemetry args, which will be enabled (for example, in
 > general_config/minimal.yml) when 'release != newton', this will
 > lead to overcloud deployment failure since 'environments/disable-telemetry.yaml'
 > is not included in tripleo-heat-templates stable/newton branch.

Yeah great point, I've yet to actually test a full deployment while using the stable/newton branch for THT but assume it would fail for the reasons you have outlined above. Maybe we could check overcloud_release, if set, before including the disable-telemetry environment?"}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2017-11-24 10:19:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > I'm thinking if we could use this config for a full deployment of
 > > master undercloud + newton overcloud, not restricted to keystone
 > > only demo. if that's the case, then there is a minor issue about
 > > telemetry args, which will be enabled (for example, in
 > > general_config/minimal.yml) when 'release != newton', this will
 > > lead to overcloud deployment failure since 'environments/disable-telemetry.yaml'
 > > is not included in tripleo-heat-templates stable/newton branch.
 > 
 > Yeah great point, I've yet to actually test a full deployment while
 > using the stable/newton branch for THT but assume it would fail for
 > the reasons you have outlined above. Maybe we could check
 > overcloud_release, if set, before including the disable-telemetry
 > environment?

yes, I commented out the telemetry code and the build can succeed.
we could check overcloud_release to determine whether or not including telemetry yaml file."}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2017-12-06 13:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

To be able to use it in a featureset ci we would need to have that file under the tripleo-ci directory.  Maybe a symlink here and the real file in tripleo-ci ?'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2017-12-06 13:23:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2017-12-06 13:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
config: Provide a Master UC and Newton OC release config

This simple config will enable developers working on the upcoming
fast-forward upgrades feature in Queens to easily install an initial
development environment.

Change-Id: I12d152af5005068ffa7f0d0616622842520f7a1d

commit_message:
Remove osd_pool_default_min_size to allow Ceph cluster to do the right thing by default

The default value is 0 which has the minimum number be caluclated based on the replica count
from osd_pool_defaut_size. The default replica count is 3 and the calculated min_size is 2.
If the replica count is 1 then the min_size is 1. ie: min_size = replica - (replica/2)
Add CephPoolDefaultSize parameter to ceph-mon.yaml. This parameter defaults to 3 but can
be overriden. See puppet-ceph-devel.yaml for an example

Change-Id: Ie9bdd9b16bcb9f11107ece614b010e87d3ae98a9
(cherry picked from commit cdfe03566354b938e94c6863b0d4b1c3e64cc10c)

commit_message:
Remove osd_pool_default_min_size to allow Ceph cluster to do the right thing by default

The default value is 0 which has the minimum number be caluclated based on the replica count
from osd_pool_defaut_size. The default replica count is 3 and the calculated min_size is 2.
If the replica count is 1 then the min_size is 1. ie: min_size = replica - (replica/2)
Add CephPoolDefaultSize parameter to ceph-mon.yaml. This parameter defaults to 3 but can
be overriden. See puppet-ceph-devel.yaml for an example

Change-Id: Ie9bdd9b16bcb9f11107ece614b010e87d3ae98a9
(cherry picked from commit cdfe03566354b938e94c6863b0d4b1c3e64cc10c)

[{'created': '2017-12-19 01:08:23.000000000', 'message': 'Remove certificate before updating it

Containerized HAProxy always tries to load the SSL certificate; if TLS
is not enabled it will create the file as a directory. This messes up
with the script that actually injects the HAProxy certificate into the
undercloud. To address this, we update that script to take this into
account.

Change-Id: Ifc748648cc0f8caaf5a551fd0bc5724b94f3087d
Closes-Bug: #1728267
(cherry picked from commit d1f3b1f683216cf728846c6403994baefe02d5d6)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove certificate before updating it

Containerized HAProxy always tries to load the SSL certificate; if TLS
is not enabled it will create the file as a directory. This messes up
with the script that actually injects the HAProxy certificate into the
undercloud. To address this, we update that script to take this into
account.

Change-Id: Ifc748648cc0f8caaf5a551fd0bc5724b94f3087d
Closes-Bug: #1728267
(cherry picked from commit d1f3b1f683216cf728846c6403994baefe02d5d6)

subject: Adding idempotent IDs to tempest tests
messages: [{'account_id': 16353, 'date': '2017-12-16 21:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2017-12-18 08:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2017-12-19 19:14:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-16 21:03:57.000000000', 'message': 'Adding idempotent IDs to tempest tests

Following the tempest HACKING guidelines [1], every tempest test must
have an idempotent ID in order to uniquely identify it even if it is
moved in the source tree.

I am adding these IDs in order to make the networking-bgpvpn tests
suitable for inclusion in the new NFV program of the Interop WG.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/HACKING.html#test-identification-with-idempotent-id

Change-Id: I7eea3d44c7d035e521c05e1fc5f1ce4e9bf582c9
'}]
commit_message:
Adding idempotent IDs to tempest tests

Following the tempest HACKING guidelines [1], every tempest test must
have an idempotent ID in order to uniquely identify it even if it is
moved in the source tree.

I am adding these IDs in order to make the networking-bgpvpn tests
suitable for inclusion in the new NFV program of the Interop WG.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/HACKING.html#test-identification-with-idempotent-id

Change-Id: I7eea3d44c7d035e521c05e1fc5f1ce4e9bf582c9

commit_message:
Prevent changes to the ironic_tempest_plugin/ directory

Add a check to the PEP8 test to prevent changes to the
ironic_tempest_plugin/ directory.

This will be removed when we remove the ironic_tempest_plugin/
directory.

commit_message:
Add support for ssh source

For gerrit, it only support ssh source, with this patch,
you can use gerrit link ssh source for verification adding.

Change-Id: I9b0e98008f624113fcdf29b62e66f983407035e5
Closes-Bug: #1737529

commit_message:
roles: bifrost-create-vm-nodes: Set CPU model to 'host-model'

The default CPU model is the QEMU GenuineIntel/QEMU Virtual CPU which
doesn't offer the best possible performance. It's best to switch to the
'host-model' option which should make the vCPU more similar to the
host one.

Change-Id: I677064d14f53eaf6757c07016f4c22909f1b240b

commit_message:
Switch to use new base_client.BaseClient

Class 'tempest.lib.services.volume.v3.base_client.BaseClient' has moved
to 'tempest.lib.services.volume.base_client.BaseClient' in version Pike
[1] and will be removed in a future version.

[1] I645ae35daebd924c4c4523163e5419cc050bb0ed

Change-Id: I4bcc9e2c7b6fd0096dc9c8f679ef680ea0d7bbbf

commit_message:
Fix share can not be found by name in admin context

Currently, when using admin context to execute 'manila
show <share-name>' to show a share detail which is not
owned by admin, it always fails with 'No share with a
name or ID of <share-name> exists'. This patch will fix
it.

Change-Id: I96339778fa69c379863078250d5dfa7172f2c1b2
Closes-Bug: #1721787

commit_message:
Add skip check for volume revert feature

Volume revert is a new feature added in microversion 3.40, and now not all
storage backend drivers have supported this feature. So it is necessary to
add a skip check for it in Tempest tests.

Change-Id: Icbd108f62f5b308e419843b03af20c8fe1278b24

commit_message:
Revert "Allow grant_role to select users outside default domain"

Im purposing a revert so we can implement something closer to:
Related-Id: I43c97981d9e76f595efa2051b17a8425404179c4

This way we can handle it for user/role/group/project at the same time.

The correct way to deal with different projects in different domains
than users is to pass in IDs/objects as noted[0]

I do this in the upstream salt modules[1]

[0] https://github.com/openstack/python-openstacksdk/blob/master/openstack/cloud/operatorcloud.py#L1822-L1825
[1] https://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/develop/salt/states/keystone_role_grant.py#L41-L94

This reverts commit d4148ff9d6d2236d50bfe5bbe9c6cef17bf765bd.

Change-Id: Ia9f0bdf58a0df539d14b14a3b7e368a06ff6ed88

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I6d7db0622ddad17c95f3acea6b332d2180ab0426

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 2033, 'name': 'Belmiro Moreira', 'email': 'moreira.belmiro.email.lists@gmail.com', 'username': 'moreira-belmiro-email-lists'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 19944, 'name': 'Chen Hanxiao', 'email': 'chen_han_xiao@126.com', 'username': 'chenhanxiao'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27057, 'name': 'Theodoros Tsioutsias', 'email': 'theodoros.tsioutsias@cern.ch', 'username': 'ttsiouts'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2017-12-04 09:38:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2017-12-04 11:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2017-12-04 15:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-12-05 00:53:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I don't think that it is the best way to fix the bug because '__module__' and '__class__' can be specified as mentined in the bug report.
A white list should be used and a value of 'field' option should be validated by using the list.

A 'Server' resource class has 'to_dict' method, keys of the dict can be used for the validation."}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2017-12-05 14:37:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thank you for the reviews. 
@Takashi: I checked what you said with the to_dict() keys and it does work. The only problem I see is that 'host' is not a valid field with that solution:
e.g.
[devstack-009 ~]$ nova list --fields host
ERROR (CommandError): Non-existent fields are specified: [u'host']

This happens because the host name is under this attribute:
[devstack-009 ~]$ nova list --fields OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host
+--------------------------------------+-------------------------------+
| ID                                   | OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR: Host         |
+--------------------------------------+-------------------------------+
| 94bb669a-774b-4dae-9576-a690575109e2 | devstack-009                  |
+--------------------------------------+-------------------------------+

I guess a lot of people use this and I don't know if this field should be removed... Do you have any suggestions?"}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-12-06 05:42:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> @Takashi: I checked what you said with the to_dict() keys and it does work. The only problem I see is that 'host' is not a valid field with that solution:
> I guess a lot of people use this and I don't know if this field should be removed... Do you have any suggestions?

The 'host' key is added in the following lines.

https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/63d56cae7b409a2a445acac990cc8a4ee26bd0a4/novaclient/v2/shell.py#L1616-L1621

So add them ('host', 'task_state', 'instance_name', 'power_state', host_id') to the white list."}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2017-12-06 17:06:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2017-12-06 17:07:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2017-12-07 10:13:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2017-12-07 21:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

Couple minor suggestions inline, but this is looking good.'}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2017-12-08 10:21:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2017-12-08 14:32:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-12-11 04:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

LGTM. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 19944, 'date': '2017-12-12 02:09:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-12-19 17:35:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
CommandError is raised for invalid server fields

When listing servers with fields of invalid type, a TypeError was
raised. With this change and in order to ensure the validity of the
fields, we are whitelisting them using the keys of the dictionary
Resource.to_dict(). For all fields not in the whitelist a CommandError
is raised.

Change-Id: I647fa611d29745f830daadac1c3f9c1c71c2733a
Closes-Bug: #1733917

[{'account_id': 26400, 'date': '2017-12-19 06:01:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-12-19 06:01:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 26400, 'date': '2017-12-19 06:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from update-pti to updated-pti'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-12-19 07:59:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Create doc/requirements.txt

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Refer to:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124815.html

Change-Id: Ic05a55fb14741bb0802c217c81b0035b6e1f7de2

commit_message:
Create project-templates for sphinx building with python3

Let's add these to make publishing of e.g. governance and release repo
easy.

Change-Id: Iaa2c9869b3e27b8b79ad42ca35ff148be4c71fd7
Depends-On: Idd7caf7d88b56d61872906027b4ce7d743572ded
Needed-By: I091d6731a2fb4c2ed4b432abaccaabd6852f0d0f

This patch addresses 3 issues.

(1). Add subnet_id and floating_ip_address

Neutron merged a change [x]. to add subnet_id and
floating_ip_address to port's fixed_ips, which expects
both the keys in floating_ip_data and broke the unit
tests. This patch add floating_ip_address and subnet_id
to mock fip data used for tests.

(2). Change the type of sync_timeout
the other issue I observed was a math error due to use
of unrounded intervals for sync timeout. This patch changes
the type of sync_timeout to FloatOpt.

(3). Pep8 enforces a check to have third party imports before,
local project imports. This patch fixes import order as well.

TODO: some of semantics checks like inconsistent return statements
and raising format tuple has been disable and should be addressed
in a separate patch.

[x]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521707/

Change-Id: I3b498400f7b6455077e13e62eee3df4502f78dcb

commit_message:
Fix unit tests py27, py35

This patch addresses two issues (1) and (2).

(1). Add subnet_id and floating_ip_address

Neutron merged a change [x]. to add subnet_id and
floating_ip_address to port's fixed_ips, which expects
both the keys in floating_ip_data and broke the unit
tests. This patch add floating_ip_address and subnet_id
to mock fip data used for tests.

(2). Change the type of sync_timeout
the other issue I observed was a math error due to use
of unrounded intervals for sync timeout. This patch changes
the type of sync_timeout to FloatOpt.

TODO: There are pep8 issues as well, like return semantics not
correct, third party modules import order and raising format tuple
which will be addressed separately.

[x]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521707/

I've proposed a follow on patch that helps with the formatting of the API requests. This will make things easier to move into our formal documentation once the implementation lands.

Feel free to incorporate those changes into this review and abandon the follow on patch. I didn't want to repropose this specification but just show the alternative format in case that is useful.

To incorporate:

  git review -d 455709
  git review -x 522876
  git rebase -i master ## s 36684c7
  git review

Let me know if you have any questions. (8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-12-07 10:39:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

(2 comments)

Left a long response on the security concerns but the tldr is let's not worry about it right now.

Unrelatedly, though - have we thought about putting project limits under the projects API? That is, instead of GET /v3/limits/{limit_id} we'd have GET /v3/projects/{project_id}/limits/{limit_id} ? I feel like it fits a little more neatly, especially when we start talking about project hierarchies."}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-12-07 11:34:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Left a long response on the security concerns but the tldr is let's
 > not worry about it right now.
 > 
 > Unrelatedly, though - have we thought about putting project limits
 > under the projects API? That is, instead of GET /v3/limits/{limit_id}
 > we'd have GET /v3/projects/{project_id}/limits/{limit_id} ? I feel
 > like it fits a little more neatly, especially when we start talking
 > about project hierarchies.

+1 for this direction. The only problem I think is that how can the cloud admin get all projects' limits in one request?

About the error message, I think Colleen's comment is very clear. Leave the spec here to see what others think.

BTW, please feel free to update the spec due to the Q-2 deadline if I'm away during the night. Sorry that I can't update it at once."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-12-07 11:41:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> The only problem I think is that how can the cloud admin get all projects' limits in one request?

Maybe the limit object could be expanded as a property of the project and visible in GET /v3/projects? That might be making things a little over-complicated, maybe best to just stick to what we have now."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-12-07 21:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-12-07 21:23:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Left a long response on the security concerns but the tldr is let's
 > not worry about it right now.
 > 
 > Unrelatedly, though - have we thought about putting project limits
 > under the projects API? That is, instead of GET /v3/limits/{limit_id}
 > we'd have GET /v3/projects/{project_id}/limits/{limit_id} ? I feel
 > like it fits a little more neatly, especially when we start talking
 > about project hierarchies.

I think we are going to have to do at least a little bit of validation when dealing with limits and project hierarchies. For example, if I'm an administrator, I shouldn't be able to set the limit of resource X to 10 on project B and 5 on project A if project B is a child of project A, right?"}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-12-07 21:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

> I think we are going to have to do at least a little bit of validation when dealing with limits and project hierarchies. For example, if I'm an administrator, I shouldn't be able to set the limit of resource X to 10 on project B and 5 on project A if project B is a child of project A, right?

Why not? Making restrictions like that is already making choices about the hierarchical model being imposed. If A has limit 10, and its child B also has a limit 10, can B's child C have a limit of 10? Or did its parent take all of its quota?

We have project hierarchy but in terms of quotas we can still apply the "flatland" model where each project's limit is considered entirely in isolation.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-12-08 03:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-12-08 13:56:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

My comments have been addressed. I'm ok accepting this after specification freeze given wxy's frequent updates and pending there aren't any concerns from other reviewers."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2017-12-15 03:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Code-Review+2

There is a followup we need to land, but it can be a followup. It needs to describe the cases of what region matching does (and clarify):

Region, if not specified for a limit applies to <what>

Region, if specified for a limit applies to <what>

TL;DR, be sure we are clear on what is returned wrt the optional region_ids in limits.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-12-18 20:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Code-Review+1

(5 comments)

Left a couple of nitpicks but I'm generally good with this. The only thing I'm not 100% on is the error responses. I think we shouldn't be defining 401 (Unauthorized) as expected error responses here since a 401 should be an authentication failure and should only happen for obtaining a token, not really relevant here. A 403 (Forbidden) is what should be raised if a policy check fails, so we could specify that here for the admin-only actions or we could just leave it implied. Unfortunately our api-ref is all over the place on defining error responses so there's not a good reference for what we should be explicit about.

On the create and update project limits error responses there's a note "see security impact section" but that section doesn't really make it clear. The errors that could occur here are 1) unable to set a project limit due to being unable to find the corresponding registered limit or 2) forbidden due to being unauthorized for that project (403) or 3) unable to update the limit due to a hierarchical constraint that we haven't defined yet. I could see 1 being either a 400 or 404 and 3 being either a 400 or 403.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-12-18 20:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-12-19 01:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

I'm not sure either, hoping maybe Morgan has some thoughts"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-12-19 14:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

After discussing this in IRC, we seem to have settled on 404 based on our interpretations of the definitions.

commit_message:
Fix Inconsistent return statements

Pylint has check for inconsitent return statements, which
was disabled to unbreak CI, so that it can be done in part
to make sure no other bug is introduced. This patch make
return statements consistent in the repo and enable the check.

Change-Id: Id621367e414514c71facf55f7f2f944f863e1366

commit_message:
Use the new sphinx PTI for special publish jobs

Both releasenotes and docs build jobs have updated PTI job content.

As a step to rolling it out, update the direct and infra jobs to use the
new direct sphinx method. Also add -python3 versions of the jobs for the
projects that need python3.

The publish-openstack-sphinx-docs job still uses tox. The next patch
will update it as well.

Change-Id: I2d0222225f4ae6c45d09f9352c256062e2535d63
Depends-On: Idd7caf7d88b56d61872906027b4ce7d743572ded

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Saving to a stream in download_object.

Users can still use a path (str) but specifying a stream
is more flexible for developers.

Change-Id: Ie6e005060b8355f2dcddb811ff4efe661b78b56c

Now that the resource and proxy reviews are out there, this should probably be rebased on them rather than perpetuating path_args.

Additionally, this tag stuff probably needs a total rewrite. The concept of tags doesn't seem to map directly to what we're generally doing, so the specialization is closer to metadata but not quite. There's no concept of ID here so overloading that functionality isn't exactly right.

Also, is it correct that you can only create and delete tags? Is there no way to get or list them?"}, {'account_id': 10485, 'date': '2016-05-03 11:04:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Now that the resource and proxy reviews are out there, this should
 > probably be rebased on them rather than perpetuating path_args.
 > 
 > Additionally, this tag stuff probably needs a total rewrite. The
 > concept of tags doesn't seem to map directly to what we're
 > generally doing, so the specialization is closer to metadata but
 > not quite. There's no concept of ID here so overloading that
 > functionality isn't exactly right.
 > 
 > Also, is it correct that you can only create and delete tags? Is
 > there no way to get or list them?

Hi Brian,

Yes, This is correct that we can only create and delete tags. There is no way to get or list them in glance.

IMHO, we should fix the broken APIs first and the refactoring thing we can do with the resource refactoring task as it applies on complete image module which may take some more time so we should not hold the broken things to be fixed for resource refactoring."}, {'account_id': 8257, 'date': '2016-05-03 14:04:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

This change isn't going to be released before the refactor, so it would just be changed anyway. I'll take a look at this before I do the image refactor and see what should happen."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-08-09 21:31:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 04:57:10.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-12-19 17:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fix image tag apis

Fixed image create and delete tag APIs by adding the required 'image'
parameter to the respective methods in order to pass 'path_args'
parameter required for creating and deleting tags.

Closes-Bug: 1557297
Change-Id: I7c810a6e233cca312325cd1a3489591ba4914795

commit_message:
Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess

os.popen() is deprecated since version 2.6. Resolved with use of
subprocess module.

Change-Id: I6c43e863e62fdcc61b350422b48c9cfd8d7e7632
Closes-Bug: #1529836

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-18 21:07:15.000000000', 'message': "Only log text responses

_log_response will try to log the body of the response even if it's
binary data. Not only is almost certainly not what is wanted in the
log, it also interacts poorly with requests and will waste a ton of
time futilely trying to figure out the encoding of the binary data.

Change-Id: I2f9fba71bfd5ab1d8a38387a1aadc9b7fff93600
Closes-Bug: #1517573
"}]
commit_message:
Only log text responses

_log_response will try to log the body of the response even if it's
binary data. Not only is almost certainly not what is wanted in the
log, it also interacts poorly with requests and will waste a ton of
time futilely trying to figure out the encoding of the binary data.

Change-Id: I2f9fba71bfd5ab1d8a38387a1aadc9b7fff93600
Closes-Bug: #1517573

commit_message:
Setup devstack-early log

The whole devstack log is written into the console output
(job-output.txt) and into devstacklog.txt.

Remove it from job-output and add a devstack-early log file (same as in
legacy job) that includes all the output of stack.sh.

Make sure the log file is pulled into the stage folder so that it will
end up on logs.o.o.

Change-Id: Ia7c1d8fe5cc03d15f455c6e62ebf4a5f6d62ab1f

commit_message:
Add a few more devstack confs and logs

Add localrc for places where it may be still used.
Collect verify_tempest_conf.

Change-Id: I733c6472e8452ed6fc04c6de1c170713812a436f

commit_message:
Fix multinode scenario

devstack-gate should only be executed on the primary node, will cause
erros when run on the secondary.

Change-Id: Iebea66e25c81e1571a5506e3a6b4bf3b8195ddbd

Just curious, what happens in the case of a log rotation and some of the timestamp values are missing for a particular entry in the provided log file?'}, {'account_id': 7921, 'date': '2017-10-23 15:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7921, 'date': '2017-10-23 15:29:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Just curious, what happens in the case of a log rotation and some
 > of the timestamp values are missing for a particular entry in the
 > provided log file?

Currently this is a very simple approach that can take either a file or be piped into. You can send it the joined files as pipe in this case.

If an entry is missing a start or end it won't be taken into account"}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2017-10-24 02:18:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

There is a lot of functionality that's not tested. You can change the code in so many ways and still pass the test."}, {'account_id': 7921, 'date': '2017-11-16 06:42:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > There is a lot of functionality that's not tested. You can change
 > the code in so many ways and still pass the test.

Anything concrete?
Otherwise don't just -1."}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2017-11-16 15:19:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

> > (2 comments)
 > >
 > > There is a lot of functionality that's not tested. You can change
 > > the code in so many ways and still pass the test.
 > 
 > Anything concrete?
 > Otherwise don't just -1.

For example, 
  - in `print_stats()` some examples: does not check that the results are actually ordered (check by commenting l117-118); l127 not covered.
  - in `analyze_entries()` some examples: it should check with more than one entry and with mixed types (recorded|completed)=(True|False) (if not I can easily replace the `continue` on L101 with a `return []` and it will pass the tests
  - `matched_lines` is not tested at all
  - in `parse_log` some examples: as with `analyze_entries` you need to check for many different items valid/not valid/malformed/etc (as you iterate by them and the matcher will have different behaviors depending whether it matches or not
  - `_percentile` (non-voting as it is a private function) is not tested
  - in `main` for example the tests are not actually testing what you expect as behavior, you are testing that it prints something vaguely related. You can easily fool the test; there is a case where you return 1, where is that contemplated; what about cases where the parameters are not the expected?"}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2017-11-17 16:47:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Just wanted to chime in and say that I used the tool to analyze a 4G big neutron-server log and it worked fine. It took about 45 minutes to run and was using 100% CPU.

commit_message:
Add command line tool to analyze logs

This tool can be used to analyze logs and determine the journal's
operation efficiency.
The tool tracks a journal entry's recording and processing to determine
how much time it took since a journal entry was recorded until it was
processed and sent to ODL.

For this purpose, some minor logging was added to the journal code to
log when an entry is recorded and when it was processed.

Change-Id: Ic77762ed29913a3d1109d156ded0f77a8ac4f403

I like the idea, however, for the size of thread pool, it would be quite different for different compute nodes that running with different types of hypervisors.
Could you find a better way than hard code the number?'}, {'account_id': 8276, 'date': '2015-09-23 09:25:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I try to find out some samples about how to set the size of thread pool in nova, actually ComputeManager._sync_power_pool is used in almost same case with init_pool, that make me confused, why _sync_power_pool can use the fixed and hand code pool size? I think the pool size is internal value, it shouldn't been exported to user/operator as an option, and it's difficult to guide the users which value is suitable, 300? 400? 500?

However no matter which value of pool size is set, it will be better than current implemented, right?"}, {'account_id': 8276, 'date': '2015-09-28 07:09:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-09-28 08:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

Booting an instance is expensive, and triggers io load, which may increase failure rates of these booting. Doing in parallel is not really guarunteed to be faster than serial, and in some situations will actually be slower.

So this isn't a simple bug fix. It's something which we really should have a spec for. There definitely has to be a max number which is < 200. It should also have some real world boot data to see how this plays out in real world situations."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-03-07 07:30:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

> Booting an instance is expensive, and triggers io load, which may increase failure rates of these booting. Doing in parallel is not really guarunteed to be faster than serial, and in some situations will actually be slower.

This isn't during creation of an instance, it's during start of the compute service where it processes instances running on this host."}]

commit_message:
Execute _init_instance() concurrently

All the instances on one compute host would be init
one by one when nova-compute launch. That might be
a slow process if lots of instances exist in one host.
The nova-compute would be joined into service group
after all instances init finish, so after a long time
the nova-compute service was set to "up" state since
it was launched. Execute _init_instance() for each
instance in separated greenthread, accelerate the init
instances process.

Closes-Bug: #1496334

Change-Id: I2fa19e1b1d31b9b0cd209f50c38b451b1e78bdf7

commit_message:
Use stage_dir instead of /opt/stack

Historically we have collected devstack logs under /opt/stack.
Stop doing that and collect them in the stage_dir instead, so that
once the base job logs pull service comes around we are ready for it.

This add the benefit of writing things into a folder which is
already owned by the ansible user (ansible_user_dir), so we don't
run into issue writing there.

A few logs (devstack log, log summary and dstat) use to show up on
logs.o.o. just because they happened to already be in /opt/stack/logs.
With this change they would be lost, so adding them to post.yaml.

Depends-on: I5ad4dfccbc1389da3afc53f3c866d3475e006db6

Change-Id: Ib4be2f5056c0dc2b776de4a0d18b47b12624be92

commit_message:
Validate configured vSwitches

This change ensures that the configured vSwitches exist and that
the OVS extension is not enabled (such vSwitches are not supported
by those agents), which is a common configuration mistake.

For now, we'll stop the agent at init time if any configured vSwitch
is invalid.

Depends-On: I221622bc050cf634f86edde49e26c09ee30b177e

Change-Id: I93dd40b5322515e93343b6e1f161ac9b0078a0c1
Closes-Bug: #1592777

commit_message:
Avoid using implicit vSwitch names

We're currently using implicit vSwitch names for local networks
as well as physnets that are not included in the physnet mappings,
in which case we try to use vSwitches having the same name.

This change drops this behavior.

Change-Id: Id560b5a8c6a5f365f0d05a61c44739306dfebfdf
Closes-Bug: #1231101

[{'created': '2017-12-19 14:57:37.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that all release files are in the manifest

Ansible 2.3 introduced a new option to the find module, but
in doing so they also implemented a breaking change.

Previously the find module would find both files and links
by default, but now it only finds files unless you tell it
specifically to find links.

As all the python wheels in the os-releases folder are links,
we tell the find module to find anything in the folder so
that the manifest file is complete.

Change-Id: Id4ebb2aa6de85a7a2d048bede787240493aadfec
(cherry picked from commit 9ebda8ad089334aae2c497afdc0af92c64aa53f4)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that all release files are in the manifest

Ansible 2.3 introduced a new option to the find module, but
in doing so they also implemented a breaking change.

Previously the find module would find both files and links
by default, but now it only finds files unless you tell it
specifically to find links.

As all the python wheels in the os-releases folder are links,
we tell the find module to find anything in the folder so
that the manifest file is complete.

Change-Id: Id4ebb2aa6de85a7a2d048bede787240493aadfec
(cherry picked from commit 9ebda8ad089334aae2c497afdc0af92c64aa53f4)

commit_message:
Add parameter to configure instance defaults

New parameter accepts a hash value to configure
the LAUNCH_INSTANCE_DEFAULTS options in horizon
configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1721774
Change-Id: I778b3dc076d611d40205edbe0982141a815e1830
(cherry picked from commit f583d96659bb8f9b0258fdb90b0b291ed1c43a4b)

commit_message:
Allow configuring 'CREATE_IMAGE_DEFAULTS' setting

Horizon now has the option of selecting various defaults for the
create image panel.  This patch allows configuring those options.

Change-Id: I01d9fc44d957394acc4243f3ee34e6e50eec0bdf
(cherry picked from commit c60cb1a3927839014005af8ffda0433081331146)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-19 07:36:35.000000000', 'message': "[log]: Change entry point name of logging plugin

The name ('logapi') seems redundant 'api' and it looks inconsistent
with entry point name of logging agent extension ('log') and
LoggingPlugin class[1]. So this patch change 'logapi' to 'log' to
make it look consistent.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/services/logapi/logging_plugin.py#L27

Change-Id: I57d0b86823670a1dc5d116d98059993c802ef86c
Partially-implements: blueprint security-group-logging
Related-Bug: #1468366
"}]
commit_message:
[log]: Change entry point name of logging plugin

The name ('logapi') seems redundant 'api' and it looks inconsistent
with entry point name of logging agent extension ('log') and
LoggingPlugin class[1]. So this patch change 'logapi' to 'log' to
make it look consistent.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/services/logapi/logging_plugin.py#L27

Change-Id: I57d0b86823670a1dc5d116d98059993c802ef86c
Partially-implements: blueprint security-group-logging
Related-Bug: #1468366

commit_message:
[placement] Add x-openstack-request-id in API ref

Add the description about 'x-openstack-request-id'
in the request and the response headers.

Change-Id: I6ffdfbacb81660b89d7bf8ba83dbab1aa25a80bd
Closes-Bug: #1733496

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I1b1cd33db1121a714cbe4420884327fedeacf809

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I4cc31ac356e8bb3404f8629f54a75b1f6d481189

commit_message:
Fix the docs job after moving to build-sphinx

With the recent change to the openstack-docs job[0], the docs
for keystone were failing due to the current job not taking the
currently auto-generated API documents into account. This changes
the tox.ini job to match what was mentioned in the notice[0] and
leaves a note in the offending file to fix the issue.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: I39e1e8d549ff099cbb51515877a44020ad912c95

I was thinking if it would be useful to rename the file into something like hyperconverged-ceph-deprecated.yaml , thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-11-09 13:58:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> I was thinking if it would be useful to rename the file into
 > something like hyperconverged-ceph-deprecated.yaml , thoughts?

I'd rather keep it with the same name. I don't see any other environment files with "-deprecated" in their name but a grep for deprecated does turn up a list of files so that seems to be the convention. Also, I think people will look for that file and if they use it without enabling the StorageMgmt network for the Compute role, they will look at it and find the deprecation notice and follow the steps to resolve their issue.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2017-11-10 07:01:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2017-11-15 15:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-09 04:44:15.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate hyperconverged-ceph.yaml

hyperconverged-ceph.yaml references ports/storage_mgmt.yaml,
which was removed so that it would instead be rendered by the
changes introduced with composable networks. Due to the removal,
using hyperconverged-ceph.yaml causes failure as per bug #1731104.

This file was introduced in Newton to allow for HCI deployments
without requiring the user to edit roles_data.yaml. However, a
more general solution exists to use composable roles without
manually editing roles_data.yaml. This change adds a comment
describing how to use the new method instead.

Change-Id: I72a29a1ddb77fbdf10c9cf190d2ad5e02100d138
Closes-Bug: #1731104

commit_message:
Deprecate hyperconverged-ceph.yaml

This file was introduced in Newton to allow for HCI deployments
without requiring the user to edit roles_data.yaml. However, a
more general solution exists to use composable roles without
manually editing roles_data.yaml. This change adds a comment
describing how to use the new method instead.

Change-Id: I72a29a1ddb77fbdf10c9cf190d2ad5e02100d138
Closes-Bug: #1731104

commit_message:
Make request_spec.spec MediumText

request_spec.instance_group.members is a list of instance UUIDs. It
can get so long that it overflows its TEXT column. This patch changes
request_spec.spec to MEDIUMTEXT.

NOTE(artom): Conflicts in
nova/tests/functional/db/api/test_migrations.py because of backport
migration renumbering. Also the uuids module isn't in newton so
a hard-coded uuid is used.

NOTE(mriedem): Since this is a backport, this contains a release
note not found in the original change on master.

Change-Id: I6bf0fa19b72887803e77b66698587c2108c9372a
Closes-bug: 1738094
(cherry picked from commit 40d74339082fe0eb1ce9216e89cf6e65a39e6968)
(cherry picked from commit 1cfcc406437c8ff3734bffef736407dc2a6440d9)
(cherry picked from commit 4f0ff43c79c02689a118dc8100187c19b5c21238)

commit_message:
Ensure that all release files are in the manifest

Ansible 2.3 introduced a new option to the find module, but
in doing so they also implemented a breaking change.

Previously the find module would find both files and links
by default, but now it only finds files unless you tell it
specifically to find links.

As all the python wheels in the os-releases folder are links,
we tell the find module to find anything in the folder so
that the manifest file is complete.

Change-Id: Id4ebb2aa6de85a7a2d048bede787240493aadfec

commit_message:
WIP: Manage metrics units in yaml configuration.

Allow users and operators to control the conversions units,
by filling source and destinations units for the metrics.
Differents units can now be affected to metrics from a same resource.

Task: 6077
Story: 2001396

Change-Id: I5c701effa6baaf1f0df496285b61eac7dc70d15f

commit_message:
Octavia driver to honor Octavia API status codes

Currently the Octavia driver for neutron-lbaas is not honoring Octavia API
status codes. This can lead to a race condition where the status update
thread is behind the actual object status in Octavia.
This updates the driver to raise the appropriate status code to the
neutron API.

Story: 2001257
Task: 5787
(cherry picked from commit cfea70bdc4b759e31ef6a87cdaf79b9d1baea572)

Change-Id: Ib182dfc208fb10dd010a370b52e9bb23ec2f8fa8

commit_message:
Move traits from "high" to "essential" priority

During the weekly Ironic meeting on 11-Dec-2017 it was decided that
the traits work was an essential priority, since in Rocky release,
nova is planning on replacing the ComputeCapabilitiesFilter with the
traits processing in placement API.

Added mgoddard as a contact as they have agreed to work on the code.

Change-Id: Ibc5e333f7f29ba51c1d63f226ab7703b6c3bdc7f

commit_message:
Ensure rsyncd PID file is removed during overcloud updates

During an overcloud update it might happen that the rsyncd container
gets killed & restarted, leaving a PID file from rsyncd. rsyncd won't
start because of this, which results in a container restarting loop.

This patch ensures the PID file is absent to fix this.

Closes-Bug: 1734674
Change-Id: Ie5b28005f1079e432cfca6c31d28295174e06986
(cherry picked from commit 570c95741200a31c5e6a3ff36447625e1cb398c7)

devstack: redis on opensuse needs to have default config

this patch adds a default config and uses template version of
unit-file to restart redis

Change-Id: I3c3498f408ac832c50d8f0e1834247492570fd4c

commit_message:
Deprecate configurable Hide Server Address Feature

This commit deprecates the config option and policy
for hide server address. They are marked for removal.

Implement blueprint remove-configurable-hide-server-address-feature

Depends-On: I6aed4909b0e7efe9c95d1f7398db613eca05e5ce
Change-Id: I6040e8c2b3e132b0dfd09f82ae041b4786a63483

commit_message:
Implement VHD attach/detach

This change adds support for attaching/detaching VHD images, as well
as retrieving the attached disk "physical" path.

This also adds support for changing disk online/readonly status,
as well as retrieving its size.

This feature will be used by os-brick, aiming to add volume backup
support for the Windows SMB Cinder driver.

Implements: blueprint vhd-attach-detach

Change-Id: I4ed28606a7f5643a2ccfef24d198649e28c59a3b

subject: Add processutils module
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-24 12:24:48.000000000', 'message': 'Add processutils module

This change adds a processutils module, which includes several
process/job helpers.

Associating a job with a process will allow ensuring that when a
parent process is killed, processes associated with jobs (e.g. child
processes) will be killed as well.

This is especially useful for Cinder, which will use it for the
multiple backend per service scenario.

Job objects may have resource limits. We may use jobs in order to
implement resource limit support within oslo_concurrency (currently
not available on Windows).

Related-Bug: #1734334

Change-Id: Icc2bbe9191e6db685c0fd294abc1d0eb24bc420c

commit_message:
Add processutils module

This change adds a processutils module, which includes several
process/job helpers.

Associating a job with a process will allow ensuring that when a
parent process is killed, processes associated with jobs (e.g. child
processes) will be killed as well.

This is especially useful for Cinder, which will use it for the
multiple backend per service scenario.

Job objects may have resource limits. We may use jobs in order to
implement resource limit support within oslo_concurrency (currently
not available on Windows).

Related-Bug: #1734334

Change-Id: Icc2bbe9191e6db685c0fd294abc1d0eb24bc420c

commit_message:
Murano dashboard imports heat.py from Heat dashboard

Now that Heat is separate from Horizon, the Murano
dashboard file, tabs.py, must change its import of
the file, heat.py, from openstack_dashboard to
heat_dashboard.

Change-Id: I92ec24a70814da21b1332d6ba069b2f141bccb87

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 11:52:34.000000000', 'message': 'Redirect VM console dynamically

Previously when a user accesses the network topology panel
horizon resolves VM console URL when returning server data.
This requires one API call to nova per VM, and this causes
a scaling issue.

Actually there is no need to resolves VM console URL when
the network topology. A console URL corresponding to a requested
VM can be resolved when a user actually accesses a console.
This reduces the number of API calls drastically and addresses
the scaling issue reported in the bug report.

Change-Id: Icc667449e2988e6227012a6e899835a97ce0d738
Closes-Bug: #1723142

commit_message:
Redirect VM console dynamically

Previously when a user accesses the network topology panel
horizon resolves VM console URL when returning server data.
This requires one API call to nova per VM, and this causes
a scaling issue.

Actually there is no need to resolves VM console URL when
the network topology. A console URL corresponding to a requested
VM can be resolved when a user actually accesses a console.
This reduces the number of API calls drastically and addresses
the scaling issue reported in the bug report.

Change-Id: Icc667449e2988e6227012a6e899835a97ce0d738
Closes-Bug: #1723142

[{'created': '2017-12-12 17:23:12.000000000', 'message': 'Pass mountpoint to volume attachment_update

The old volume attach flow would pass the mountpoint,
which is the BlockDeviceMapping.device_name, to the
os-attach volume action API. With the new flow, apparently
the mountpoint is expected to be passed to the update
attachment API via the connector dict, which is not obvious
and if not provided, causes Cinder to default the mountpoint
to "/dev/na" which is wrong.

We work around this in Nova by providing the mountpoint in a
copy of the connector dict and pass that to attachment_update,
and update the two places in the code that are updating an
attachment (the normal driver block device attach code and
swap volume). Long-term this should be fixed in the Cinder
attachments update API, but that requires a microversion so
we need to handle it client-side for now.

Change-Id: I11ba269c3f7a2e7707b2b7e27d26eb7a2c948a82
Partial-Bug: #1737779

commit_message:
Pass mountpoint to volume attachment_update

The old volume attach flow would pass the mountpoint,
which is the BlockDeviceMapping.device_name, to the
os-attach volume action API. With the new flow, apparently
the mountpoint is expected to be passed to the update
attachment API via the connector dict, which is not obvious
and if not provided, causes Cinder to default the mountpoint
to "/dev/na" which is wrong.

We work around this in Nova by providing the mountpoint in a
copy of the connector dict and pass that to attachment_update,
and update the two places in the code that are updating an
attachment (the normal driver block device attach code and
swap volume). Long-term this should be fixed in the Cinder
attachments update API, but that requires a microversion so
we need to handle it client-side for now.

Change-Id: I11ba269c3f7a2e7707b2b7e27d26eb7a2c948a82
Partial-Bug: #1737779

commit_message:
Set VIP port to be enabled

Some SDN controllers (e.g. Dragonflow) respect this field and do not
wire the port unless it is enabled.

Change-Id: I2b290aa84855abf4bab21e7b56d63a140b04d91d
Partial-Bug: #1736351

commit_message:
Set VIP port to be enabled

Some SDN controllers (e.g. Dragonflow) respect this field and do not
wire the port unless it is enabled.

Change-Id: I1d46ea9cf156e5e71e9f71368db05f1129dc7aa5
Closes-Bug: #1736351

commit_message:
logging: support service_config_settings configuration mechanism

This commit implements the necessary support in puppet-tripleo to
process fluentd configuration delivered via service_config_settings.

Added the fluentd unit test regarding the new configuration:
- A file by service
- Added the group to the fluentd user

Partial-bug: #1715187
Change-Id: I2b057190ec0e4e75ee4ee47ebe0164c2644e5ab7

commit_message:
designate variables for neutron integration

This adds designate and keystone variables needed for
designate integration in neutron.

Change-Id: I46316c658a3746f91313641e5a26de49a03b2164

we defined twice the path of rally globals,

commit_message:
Remove the 'name' attribute from FloatingIP

No one is using this field, and there is no real reason to keep it.
Also, the OVO FloatingIP does not have this field any more, so it would
be wise to remove it here as well.

Change-Id: I7f34e5d3f01fe49d25b0630348c0bcd01df2c1de
Closes-Bug: #1738620

commit_message:
Add release note about the ostestr tox job

The ostestr tox job was recently removed from the tempest tox.ini,
mostly because we're moving towards standardizing on just using stestr
for everything and dropping the dependency on os-testr. During the
review that removed the job, some concerns were raised that it might
break people. To address that this commit adds a release note explaining
the potential upgrade implications and how to work around the removal.

Change-Id: Ibc59e01af9f5a9c4d8c67fbde1f029decf602226

params workflow inputs num_phy_cores_per_numa_node_for_pmd
and huge_page_allocation_percentage.

mod_wsgi hangs trying to import the recent versions of
python-gobject-base used by python-keyring library, which is in turn
used by python-keystoneclient. This does not happen if the
WSGIApplicationGroup is global.

Change-Id: I4c7408699fddf327feb1c3b47e8e47cf2dd946f1

commit_message:
Set WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL} as recommended

mod_wsgi hangs trying to import the recent versions of
python-gobject-base used by python-keyring library, which is in turn
used by python-keystoneclient. This does not happen if the
WSGIApplicationGroup is global.

Change-Id: I4c7408699fddf327feb1c3b47e8e47cf2dd946f1
Closes-Bug: #1708655
Closes-Bug: #1624791
Related-Bug: #1700176

commit_message:
Implement query param schema for migration index

GET migration API accept query params to filter the
migrations.

This commit adds json schema to validating the valid
query parameters.

Partially implements blueprint json-schema-validation-for-query-param

Change-Id: I424c913cf41fcbe65761b77951f374ad758d26a4

commit_message:
Tempest container image

Add tempest container image to the undercloud to be able to run
the tempest as a separate application in its own container on
the undercloud host.

commit_message:
Fix docker image function

- Make docker image function work, add functional tests
- Use 'result' instead of 'output' in execution response
- Support string as execution input
- Update python runtime

Partially implements: blueprint qinling-functional-tests
Change-Id: Ie7e59983cfbc6f9e8514438e30a854f372a4c4d7

commit_message:
Add MySQL connection SSL support

When 'cinder_galera_use_ssl' is True, use an encrypted connection to
the database using either a self-signed or user-provided CA certificate.

A new non-voting test has been added to verify that the role remains
functional when enabling SSL features.

Partial-Bug: 1667789

Change-Id: Ifeda0acb4b70ba313e6572c806125d31ab3eb300
Depends-On: I95cc994df5118fce7ce588fc0bff979bc283a6f3

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-01-14 21:43:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30: Code-Review-1

This idea is great! Checked this running inside a Ubuntu Xenial VM.
It is worth to continue working on it!

The -1 is because there are some problems, like /etc/qemu is not available under Ubuntu, the TRAP is somewhat late (had to remove the bridge manually).

It would be great if it could be extended that it would be possible to execute commands in the VM.

What do you think about using the same VMs as created by run_functest.sh? There is not really the need to create them twice.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 04:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)

commit_message:
Make request_spec.spec MediumText

request_spec.instance_group.members is a list of instance UUIDs. It
can get so long that it overflows its TEXT column. This patch changes
request_spec.spec to MEDIUMTEXT.

NOTE(artom): Conflicts in
nova/tests/functional/db/api/test_migrations.py because of backport
migration renumbering.

NOTE(mriedem): Since this is a backport, this contains a release
note not found in the original change on master.

Change-Id: I6bf0fa19b72887803e77b66698587c2108c9372a
Closes-bug: 1738094
(cherry picked from commit 40d74339082fe0eb1ce9216e89cf6e65a39e6968)
(cherry picked from commit 9adf97c0132c3e0d34bbb2e33b59c6e5b00bec57)

trivial: Pass InstanceNUMATopology to consume_request

We're going to use some fields other than 'cells' in a future patch.
Keep that future patch simply by doing the necessary work here.

bp share-pci-between-numa-nodes

if the dimension name is "name". It appears that certain strings are

commit_message:
Fix InfluxDB repository list_dimension_values to support "name".

Fix issue where InfluxDB repository fails to return dimension values list
if the dimension name is "name". It appears that certain strings are
interpreted specially by InfluxDB and therefore require double quotes.

Change-Id: I7629e68e3f5c38567f80cbb93419f40ecb3b6d9f
Story: 2000968
Task: 4117
(cherry picked from commit a7f313713491cff3eeb8e3e5dd27410d2133fa8f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-15 22:11:30.000000000', 'message': 'Remove old /etc/profile config block

When the openstack-ansible-security role became ansible-hardening,
a new config block was added to `/etc/profile` without removing
the original one with the openstack-ansible-security markers. This
causes errors on the command prompt since `TMOUT` is defined twice.

This patch removes the old config block using blockinfile.

Closes-Bug: 1736702
Change-Id: I2768182f5dde3368028a1a25af69db6ac7a75d9b
(cherry picked from commit c8a59a1c9ac00f0e6f9625a2786e3a1fa5168e28)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove old /etc/profile config block

When the openstack-ansible-security role became ansible-hardening,
a new config block was added to `/etc/profile` without removing
the original one with the openstack-ansible-security markers. This
causes errors on the command prompt since `TMOUT` is defined twice.

This patch removes the old config block using blockinfile.

Closes-Bug: 1736702
Change-Id: I2768182f5dde3368028a1a25af69db6ac7a75d9b
(cherry picked from commit c8a59a1c9ac00f0e6f9625a2786e3a1fa5168e28)

[{'created': '2017-12-06 09:41:28.000000000', 'message': "Improve recordset create UI

The current implementation has '--records' as a quasi-positional
argument, with the nargs='+' parameter it can only be used at the end of
the command, which is confusing to users and doesn't comply with the
help message.

Add a new option '--record' that takes only exactly one record as

commit_message:
Improve recordset create UI

The current implementation has '--records' as a quasi-positional
argument, with the nargs='+' parameter it can only be used at the end of
the command, which is confusing to users and doesn't comply with the
help message.

Add a new option '--record' that takes only exactly one record as
parameter and can be repeated when multiple records are present.
Deprecate the old option so it can be removed in the future.

Change-Id: I8fefd9d0f104170d50c5d5dc3cbcc53facda9baf
Closes-Bug: 1736161

Support DevStack installation with WSGI

a WSGI process. uWSGI deployment is enabled by default.

commit_message:
Cleanup test-requirements

python-subunit is not used directly anywhere
and it is dependency of both testrepository
and os-testr
(probably was used by some tox wrapper script before)

Change-Id: I521306a88c0179a72316ebabdaa435debcac6ab2

commit_message:
Revert "Update oslo.service to 1.28.1"

This version introduced a regression that caused it to become blacklisted in g-r, so we need to downgrade again.

This reverts commit f8283c94f683e96ad3dc0bbf4c3f185a97cf5086.

Change-Id: Iafc38ff1250d43c067de6916fb035da357e88004

commit_message:
Set restrictive file permissions on Ceph keyrings for non-containerized deployment

Pass mode parameter 0600 and user and group ownership to puppet-ceph for
Ceph openstack client keyrings during non-containerized deployment.

Author:    Keith Schincke <kschinck@redhat.com>
Co-Author:    John Fulton <fulton@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iccb24f5c2ee639ad2bc0869a37cec305f32b9fd1
Depends-On: I0c1bc3d2362c6500b1a515d99f641f8c1468754a
Partial-Bug: #1720787
(cherry picked from commit bdf1ade1b9de994c3098fb17cca6dd64b3d14cd5)

Add specs for Warp10 publisher

This feature proposes to add a Warp10 publisher for Ceilometer service.

Change-Id: I357d9d697a23bab14caf3988cfb5141556eb6507
Implements: blueprint warp10-publisher
